intro: Dipelta yunnanensis, commonly known as Yunnan dipelta, is a flowering plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
